intro: Hieracium lipadenium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, making it a common sight in meadows during the summer months.
